newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore fund industry grows 37 pct to S$90.4 bln.
newsitem.headline: Singapore fund industry grows 37 pct to S$90.4 bln.

text.p: The amount of funds managed in Singapore rose 37 percent to Singapore $90.4 billion in 1995 against S$65.9 billion in the previous year, the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) said on Wednesday.
The MAS, the de facto central bank, said the strong increase came from fund management companies transferring funds invested in Asian markets To Singapore.
The MAS said in its annual report for 1995/96 that funds from Europe and the United States accounted for 63 percent of the increase.
It said funds from investors in Europe totalled S$22.6 billion, funds from Singapore, S$16.6 billion, and funds from the United States S$15.5 billion.
The MAS said investment in equities continued to account for the bulk of the funds managed, totalling 64.3 percent or S$58.1 billion.
